info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 4:18PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS MOVING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN POTION OF THE BADGER BURN SCAR AND TRAPPER CREEK TOWARD OAKLEY THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 415 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles west of Oakley Reservoir to 20 miles southwest of Oakley, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Moderate to brief heavy rain, wind gusts to 35 mph, half inch hail, and occasional lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Moderate to heavy rain on the Badger Burn Scar may produced enhanced runoff and possibly flash flooding. Locations impacted include... Oakley Reservoir, Bostetter Ranger Station and the Badger Burn Scar. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If recreating within the Badger Burn Scar stay out of washes below heavy showers. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
